intro: Restio gracilior, commonly known as the slender restio, is a member of the Restionaceae family, native to southern Africa. It is a perennial grass-like plant characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and tall, slender flowering stems. The plant typically grows in coastal and sandy environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its inflorescence consists of dense, spike-like clusters of small white or pale blue flowers. Restio gracilior is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to tolerate coastal conditions.
